definition[0]: to pay a lot of money for something, especially unwillingly
example[0]: If you want the repairs done right, you’ll have to shell out at least $800.
example[1]: She ended up shelling out for two rooms.
definition[1]: to spend a lot of money on something, often when you do not really want to
example[2]: The insurance company refused to shell out for repairs.
example[3]: NFC shelled out £75 million on 16 businesses.
